intro: Caulinia oguraensis, commonly known as the Ogun River caladium, is a flowering plant native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, heart-shaped leaves that display vibrant colors. The plant produces small, pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to its appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found near water bodies. Due to its unique foliage, it is cultivated as a decorative plant in tropical gardens.
